snippet: The former bank officials — its founder, Sherkhan Farnood, and former chief executive, Khalilullah Frozi — had been convicted of taking $810 million from the bank and originally sentenced to five years in prison each.
abstract: Afghan judge triples sentences for Sherkhan Farnood and Khalilullah Frozi, former heads of Kabul Bank, to 15 years; men had been convicted of taking $810 million from the bank.
lead_paragraph: The former bank officials — its founder, Sherkhan Farnood, and former chief executive, Khalilullah Frozi — had been convicted of taking $810 million from the bank and originally sentenced to five years in prison each.

headline.main: Afghanistan: Terms Tripled for Officials Who Stole Millions From Kabul Bank
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan: Terms Tripled for Officials Who Stole Millions From Kabul Bank
